etymology.description: semantic: 肉(肉) (ròu, 'flesh, meat') + phonetic: 聿(聿) (yù, 'hand holding brush') = sound association with 聿 → meaning related to soft, pliable
etymology.interpretation: In the character 𦘒, 肉(肉) signifies softness, akin to the qualities of flesh, while 聿(聿) provides the phonetic aspect. This combination effectively conveys the idea of softness through sound symbolism.

examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfú mō qǐlái hěn ruǎn.
examples.english: This piece of clothing feels soft.

examples.chinese: 细雨纷纷时(細雨紛紛時)，树叶显得非常𦘒(𦘒)。
examples.pinyin: Xì yǔ fēnfēn shí, shù yè xiǎnde fēicháng ruǎn.
examples.english: When the fine rain falls, the leaves appear very soft.
